alert.note: Alert for Sheep Range; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 09 at 1:22AM PST until December 11 at 10:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sheep Range and Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and dangerous. Blowing snow may result in visibility reductions. This includes state roads 156, 157, and 158. Chain controls may also be needed in these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is the first major snow of the season for the Spring Mountains and Sheep Range to 7000 feet. As a result, this may lead to increased traffic on state roads 156, 157, and 158 as people seek recreation.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Sheep Range; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon
